name: Alto Hotel on Bourke

reviews.text: The Alto is an eco friendly hotel in a very convenient location. Its only a 3 minute walk from the Southern Cross Station where the Sky Bus comes in from the airport. Southern Cross is also a major link for trains across the metro area and Country Victoria. Just out the front of the hotel you can catch a tram up Bourke St to the shopping and restaurant precinct.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: We stayed in a King Deluxe Apartment which was roomy and comfortable and had useful features such as a microwave, coffee maker and washing facilities. A cooked breakfast was included in the price and the menu comprised a huge variety of different dishes which are prepared to order.
reviews.title: Good central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The motel was very clean with helpful reception staff. Unfortunately the walls are very thin and we had noisy neighbors, not good at 2am.Breakfast was pleasant and served promptly. The motel is adjacent to a tram stop and ver,y close to Spencer street station.
reviews.title: We keep coming back

reviews.text: Had another great stay at the ALTO. Turned up off the flight before 10am to be told that our room was ready!!!! Had a 1 bedroom suite with all the extras, fridge, sink, china and cutlery. Great to be able to bring back fresh cheese and bread from Queen Victoria market.
reviews.title: A home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is close to Southern cross station, with a tram stop practically out front that will take you down to the mall. Happy to recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: great clean friendly location

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. I only had breakfast there once, it was about 20 AUD and pretty decent – I went for the typical English breakfast.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but read first, please.

reviews.text: The hotel room was fairly small and the bathroom as well, but it was enough for me as I was only there to sleep. As I visited in the middle of Melbourne's winter, it took between 30 sec to 1 min to get warm water – this really upsets me because I hate wasting water for no reason. And mind that I was on the 1st floor, so I was theoretically closer to the machine rooms that maybe the other rooms from the upper floors.
reviews.title: Bijoux Bohemian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The internet wasn’t incredibly fast, but it worked just fine. The hotel is really in the city centre, so you'll do just fine. Right in front of it you have the train station, and in 3 min you can walk to the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent,cosy and friendly hotel in a great location

reviews.text: The problem with my room (102) is that its window was a rectangle of 1.00 m x 0.20 m. Well, I've seen smaller animals in bigger cages at the zoo. To top that, the window was some 2.00 m away from the next building, so daylight and possibilities to aerate were next to nil.
reviews.title: a good place, coozy
Outstanding for innovation
reviews.text: The personnel of the hotel was nice and the room cleaning as well. You'll have all the amenities that you will expect to find in a decent 3 stars’ hotel, but as far as labelling it a 4 stars’ hotel based on the room that I got, not in this lifetime.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location and a great hotel. We stayed for two nights over a recent weekend because of the reviews on tripadvisor and will go back again. It does live up to the reviews.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were helpful, particularly as we had a late night check in, and the atmosphere of the hotel fitted right into the Melbourne CBD location. The main train station is 150m down the road and a tram stop 100m away, so the location is very convenient. The train will get you around inner and outer Melbourne and the trams throughout the CBD and down to St Kilda.
reviews.title: Great hotel with reasonable rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The petite queen room was the only room available and it is exactly as it says - petite. However, not so small as to be uncomfortable and the bed and pillows more than made up for the lack of the extra couple of square metres. We found it okay but then we only had overnight luggage. I think it would be a bit of a squeeze for two with two large suitcases.
reviews.title: Excellent Property and Green, Too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of negatives.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in central location

reviews.text: The shower cubicle was a little tight (I am 6' 2") and the eco shower head takes a bit of getting used to. It's a strange sensation of having a shower but wondering if you are getitng wet, but works nonetheless.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Alto will probably be my top choice for a boutique hotel among all the boutique hotels I haved stayed at. Very comfortable, very clean (immaculately white towels and bed linens!) and location is not bad (at the fringe of CBD but a few steps away from Southern cross and from a tram stop). Bonuses are the impressive eco-friendly business model (power is 100% from wind power!), the elegant decor (simple lines, great b&w photos of melbourne), fast wifi access and the attentiveness of reception staff to answer all your questions. I am definitely recommending this hotel.
reviews.title: Really value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were attending a wedding so thought we would stay in central Melbourne, this was a good choice as this hotel was excellent, just the job, perfect position for tourists.
reviews.title: 13 night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleanliness was top notch, spotless in fact, complimentary tea & coffee is served allday on a help yourself basis in the breakfast room opposite the reception.
reviews.title: Comfortable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is situated in the CBD area right next to train station, Southern Cross, which is very handy.
reviews.title: Great eco-hotel for business or travel

reviews.text: Here you can buy a daily zone 1 train/tram/bus card for $8, which we bought each day to get about. The tram stop is right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Home away from home

description: Melbourne’s multi-award winning 4 star eco-friendly boutique apartment hotel that is Carbon Neutral, Green Star and Green Globe accredited.Located in the centre of Melbourne city within a 2 minute walk of the airport shuttle bus, shopping, tram stops & train station. Easy walk to major attractions. Features include rooms, studios & apartments, restaurant & bar, library & book exchange with complimentary espresso coffee, car parking, gym access, massage room, smokers lounge & wifi internet.
